intro: Notylia paniculata, commonly known as the panicled notylia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Notylia paniculata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
